about_the_game:
Pilot a giant robot against a horde of monsters in this co-op roguelike deckbuilder. Attempt each procedurally generated run alone or with a friend. Draw from and build up 2 decks at the same time, plan the sequence of each turn, and plug in the best mods. You'll need a big brain, or two, to prevent the invasion!

  • Larger than life monsters are invading the Earth! Play as a pair of scientists piloting the giant robot Super Supreme for the first time. Stronger together, you’ll figure things out from the penthouse of a walking skyscraper. It’s time to form Dream Team Supreme to save the day!

  • Two heads are better than one. When the monsters put pressure on Super Supreme, talking through problems and ideas with a friend is more enjoyable. The camaraderie and team spirit uplift the whole experience. Working together on a combo feels like a giant robot high fiving itself.

  • The beat sequence starts each turn as a blank canvas. Cleverly choose how to slot your cartridges into it, and program Super Supreme with the winning moves!

  • Single and dual-sided cartridges make for different shaped puzzle pieces to solve the beat sequence with.

  • Drawing cartridges from 2 different decks provides ample synergies and fantastic power.

  • No more hunting rats crawling through dark dungeons. Piloting Super Supreme feels like taking your favorite toy outside for an adventure in the sun. The horde of monsters of the week keep things light-hearted and wacky enough to feel like your imagination is running wild!

What's the plan?

  • Let players in on the fun of developing games

    • Develop features and content

    • Playtest updates regularly

    • Respond to player feedback

    • Repeat 1, 2, 3 until we feel ready for release

name: Dream Team Supreme
short_description: Pilot a giant robot against a horde of monsters in this co-op roguelike deckbuilder. Attempt each proc-gen run alone or with a friend. Draw from and build up 2 decks at the same time, plan the sequence of each turn, and plug in the best mods. You'll need a big brain, or two, to prevent the invasion!
